name: Tents
description: The most common and reliable shelter in mountaineering.
use_case: Used in high-altitude expeditions like Everest Base Camp.

name: Bivouac (Bivy) Shelter
description: A minimalist approach for fast and light climbing.
use_case: Climbers use bivy sacks on exposed ridges or big walls like El Capitan.

name: Snow Shelters
description: Used in winter and high-altitude mountaineering when tents are not an option.
use_case: Snow caves are common in Arctic and polar expeditions.

name: Emergency Shelters
description: Used when caught in storms or dangerous conditions.
use_case: Bothies are found in Scotland and UK mountains.

name: High-Altitude Camps
description: Climbers set up multiple camps at different elevations.
use_case: Everest has Base Camp, Camp 1, Camp 2, Camp 3, and Camp 4 before reaching the summit.

name: Portaledges
description: Hanging tents used on vertical rock faces for multi-day climbs.
examples: Used on El Capitan and other big walls
